intro: Pseudodracontium flotoi, commonly known as the Floto's pseudodracontium, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as under forest canopies. Its botanical features include a slender stem, palmately lobed leaves, and small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
